title: Tomatoes & Lean Beef Mince One-Pan
method: Prep: finely chop the tomatoes and slice the kale.
Cook components per method until protein is cooked through and veg is tender.
Rest meat 3–5 min if applicable. Season to taste with lemon, herbs, and chili to preference.
Plate as suggested below and enjoy.
plating: Serve lean beef mince neatly over grains with veg to one side; finish with chopped mint, a wedge of lemon, and a drizzle of olive oil for a clean Danish presentation.
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal, more if training on the day.
swaps: Swap grains for cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Use tofu or chicken interchangeably to suit dietary preference.
Add chili to taste for more heat.

title: Caribbean Firm Tofu with Broccoli
method: Prep: finely chop the broccoli and slice the bulgur.
Preheat oven to 150°C.
Toss firm tofu with oil, salt, pepper and spices; spread on a tray with veg.
Slow-roast for 18–24 minutes until firm tofu is cooked through (75°C internal for poultry).
Rest meat 3–5 min if applicable. Season to taste with lemon, herbs, and chili to preference.
Plate as suggested below and enjoy.
plating: Serve firm tofu neatly over grains with veg to one side; finish with chopped chives, a wedge of lemon, and a drizzle of olive oil for a clean Caribbean presentation.
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal, more if training on the day.
swaps: Swap grains for cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Use tofu or chicken interchangeably to suit dietary preference.
Add chili to taste for more heat.

title: Irish Cod Fillet with Carrots
method: Prep: finely chop the carrots and slice the peppers.
Bring sauce to a gentle simmer.
Add cod fillet; simmer 12–15 min until cooked through.
Rest meat 3–5 min if applicable. Season to taste with lemon, herbs, and chili to preference.
Plate as suggested below and enjoy.
plating: Serve cod fillet neatly over grains with veg to one side; finish with chopped dill, a wedge of lemon, and a drizzle of olive oil for a clean Irish presentation.

swaps: Swap grains for cauliflower rice for lower carbs.

Add chili to taste for more heat.
